page.title: 07EDUCATIONAL PROVISION.
page.content: The three schools involved in the compilation of this material provide an excellent cross-section of the type of educational provision that has been,and is being,provided within the local area. {HIGHFIELD HIGH SCHOOL. The school began life as two single sex Council Schools in 1933 becoming Secondary Schools after the 1944 Act. They were controlled by the Blackpool County Borough Education Committee until Local Govt.Reorganistion in 1974 when Lancs.Education Committee took over. Under the reorganisation of Secondary Education in the town in the early 1970's the two schools combined as a mixed 11-16 Comprehensive High School. At the present time the school has a total of 1000 pupils on roll and a staff of 53 plus ancillaries.
